ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotypes (autism/autistic behavior, bilateral tonic-clonic seizures, and intellectual disability) were diagnosed with DEE9. The patient's presentation matches the core features of this condition.
Classic presentation includes intellectual disability, autism, and seizures. One of the most common genetic causes of autism and intellectual disability, particularly in males.
TSC commonly presents with the triad of epilepsy, intellectual disability, and autism spectrum disorder. Seizures are often bilateral tonic-clonic type.
Similar to TSC1, caused by mutations in TSC2 gene. Presents with same triad of epilepsy, intellectual disability, and autism.
Characterized by severe intellectual disability, seizures, and autistic-like behaviors. Seizures typically begin in early childhood.
Presents with intellectual disability, autistic features, and seizures. However, more common in females and typically shows regression pattern.
Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy with intellectual disability and autistic features. Seizures are prominent feature.
Severe epileptic encephalopathy with tonic-clonic seizures, intellectual disability, and autistic behaviors. Usually begins in infancy.
